description: The Supreme Court has sought responses from the Karnataka government and Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar regarding the CBI's challenge against the withdrawal of consent for a disproportionate assets case investigation. The CBI is contesting the Karnataka High Court's order, which upheld the state government's decision to revoke the consent previously granted during the BJP's tenure.
title: SC seeks Karnataka response to CBI plea on denial of nod in DKS case

description: The Delhi High Court has directed Tihar Jail authorities to provide immediate medical treatment to separatist Yasin Malik, currently on a hunger strike. Malik, serving a life sentence for terror charges, claims to be suffering from severe cardiac and kidney ailments. The court has also sought a health status report and scheduled the next hearing for November 11.
title: Provide med aid to Yasin Malik, Delhi HC asks Tihar officials

description: The Gujarat High Court ruled that anganwadi workers and helpers are entitled to be absorbed as permanent government employees. The court ordered the central and state governments to formulate a policy for their absorption and to pay them arrears based on minimum pay scales for Class 3 and Class 4 posts.
title: HC: Formulate policy to absorb anganwadi staff in government service

description: The Supreme Court is reviewing a petition to prohibit tree felling in Delhi without its approval. The petition, prompted by data revealing the felling of five trees hourly, criticizes the Delhi Preservation of Trees Act authorities for insufficient oversight.  The petitioner emphasizes the violation of procedural safeguards within the Act and highlights the significant gap between Delhi's existing green cover and the National Forest Policy's mandate.
title: SC mulls making its nod must for all tree felling

description: India is expanding civilian access to its navigation system, NaVIC, by introducing new satellites with L1 band technology.  The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) aims to launch a dozen satellites annually by 2025 and is developing space law to support the burgeoning space sector. ISRO also plans to transfer its mini-launcher technology to the private sector within two years.
title: With 7 more sats, Isro plans civilians' access to navigation signals

description: Debashish Panda, chairman of the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority (Irdai), advocated for raising the foreign direct investment (FDI) ceiling in the insurance sector to 100% from the current 74%.  He believes this move will attract more foreign players, bolster the industry's capital base, and help achieve the government's target of 'insurance for all' by 2047.
title: Irdai chief bats for 100% FDI in insurance to boost reach

description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, during a Diwali event, asserted that pro-Khalistan separatists do not represent the entire Sikh community in Canada. This statement followed a clash between pro-Khalistan activists and attendees at a consular camp in Brampton. Trudeau emphasized that neither pro-Khalistan nor pro-Modi groups represent their respective religious communities in Canada, condemning violence and intimidation.
title: Separatists don't represent Canada's Sikhs: Justin Trudeau

description: The Supreme Court has requested a Kuki organization to provide evidence supporting the authenticity of an audio tape that allegedly implicates Manipur's Chief Minister in inciting violence. The petitioner, represented by advocate Prashant Bhushan, claims the tape reveals the CM's role in orchestrating violence in Kuki-dominated areas. The Solicitor General argued that the petition undermines the Manipur High Court's authority and represents attempts to disrupt ongoing peace efforts.
title: Kuki body asked for proof of ‘CM tape’

description: A final report has found that the tragic Kanchanjunga Express train accident in June, which resulted in 10 fatalities and 43 injuries, could have been prevented. The Commissioner of Railway Safety attributed the accident to multiple failures, including incorrect authorization given to the freight train, a lack of cautionary orders, and inadequate communication equipment.
title: Kanchanjunga Express crash was avoidable, says probe report

description: The Supreme Court has ruled that nuns and priests employed in government-aided missionary schools are subject to income tax deductions, even if they have taken vows of poverty. The court stated that salaries, even if transferred to religious congregations, are considered income and are therefore taxable.
title: Salaries of nuns & priests as teachers taxable, says SC

description: Chief Justice of India (CJI) Dhananjaya Yeshwant Chandrachud completed his 25-year judicial tenure on Friday, receiving high praise from the legal community.  His farewell ceremony, held in the Supreme Court's largest courtroom, was filled with accolades from lawyers of all ranks.  Many remarked on his youthful energy and dedication to judicial reform, highlighting his impactful judgments and use of technology to improve court accessibility.
title: Outgoing CJI: Wanted to pull out of becoming a judge, was dissuaded

description: The BJP has stated that the central government will firmly present its stance on the Aligarh Muslim University's minority status case when a new Supreme Court bench resumes the hearing.  BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia emphasized the government's commitment to upholding the Constitution, while Amit Malviya, head of BJP's IT department, highlighted past parliamentary debates where prominent figures opposed granting AMU minority status.
title: Centre will put forth its stand on AMU before new bench: BJP

description: Three judges on the seven-judge bench dissented from the majority opinion, arguing that Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) is not a minority institution. They argued that AMU was established by a law passed by the imperial parliament and is administered by the government, making it ineligible for minority status under Article 30(1) of the Constitution.
title: 3 dissenters: Can 2 judges send 5-J case to 7-J bench?

description: Tejasvi Surya, BJP MP, is facing legal action in Karnataka for a social media post.  Surya alleged a farmer's suicide was due to land confiscation by the Waqf Board, citing a media report.  However, Karnataka's Chief Minister's office dismissed the report as false, leading to an FIR against Surya for inciting enmity.
title: Tejasvi Surya booked for 'fake news' in waqf controversy

description: A 31-year-old tribal mother of three was allegedly raped and murdered in her Jiribam district home.  Armed intruders terrorized the village with gunfire, looting, and arson, leaving 17 dwellings destroyed. The victim's husband filed an FIR alleging "rape and murder based on racial and communal grounds" and demanded justice for the heinous crime.
title: Mother of 3 raped, killed in Manipur, 17 homes torched

description: Overruling a 1967 judgment, a Supreme Court bench ruled that the conversion of a minority institution into a university doesn't automatically negate its minority status. While not deciding on Aligarh Muslim University's (AMU) status, the court defined criteria for determining minority institution status, leaving it to a lower bench to rule on AMU's case.
title: SC overturns 1967 verdict that nixed AMU’s minority status

description: The Supreme Court of India reversed its 1967 ruling, recognizing Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) as a minority institution.  The campus erupted in celebration as students, faculty, and officials hailed the decision as a historic victory for minority rights and AMU's identity.  Experts who contributed to the legal battle emphasized the significance of historical evidence in validating AMU's claim.
title: A victory for minority rights: Varsity hails SC judgment

description: A nine-year-old boy, Vishnu Sangam Joshi, tragically died after being cut by a discarded nylon kite string in Nashik, India. The incident occurred while he was playing and the string severed a nerve behind his knee. Despite being rushed to the hospital, he was declared dead on arrival. Police are investigating the incident.
title: Nylon manja cut behind knee kills 9-year-old boy in Nashik

description: Three Maoists were killed in a gunfight with security forces in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur district on Friday. The encounter, which lasted for several hours, took place in the forests of Rekhpalli and Komathpalli. A sniper rifle, an SLR, and other weapons were recovered from the scene.
title: 3 Maoists killed in encounter in Bijapur, sniper rifle found

description: India witnessed a surge in extreme weather events in 2024, with Madhya Pradesh experiencing the highest number of such events and Kerala recording the most fatalities. Central India faced the brunt of these events, leading to significant loss of life and damage to crops and infrastructure. This alarming trend highlights the urgent need for climate action to mitigate future risks.
title: MP experienced extreme weather events on 176 days, the most in the country

description: Jaswant Singh Gill, a murder convict on parole, was shot dead in Gwalior, India. CCTV footage shows two assailants on a motorcycle approaching Gill and shooting him at close range. Police suspect a contract killing, potentially linked to Gill's past crime or connections to Canada where the victim's family resides.
title: Murder convict on parole shot dead in MP; cops probe likely Canada link

description: Supriya Sule, NCP (SCP) president, dismissed any possibility of an alliance with the BJP, accusing the party's leadership of orchestrating the NCP's split and attacking its reputation.  She recounted her meeting with NCP 'rebels' before they joined the BJP-Shiv Sena alliance, stating that many denied their intentions.  Sule expressed confidence in the MVA's prospects in the upcoming assembly elections.
title: BJP engineered NCP split, no question of post-poll tie-up: Supriya Sule

description: Two women, Sobha and Aarti, allegedly set five puppies on fire in Meerut's Sant Nagar Colony because their barking disturbed their sleep. The three-day-old puppies were doused in petrol and burned alive.  Although the incident occurred on Tuesday, an FIR was lodged against the women on Friday under BNS section 325 following protests by animal activists.  The accused are yet to be arrested.
title: Sleep disturbed, wives of Army & CISF personnel burn alive 5 pups

description: The Indian government's PM Vishwakarma scheme has provided skills training to over 10.8 lakh artisans and craftspeople since its launch in September. The scheme focuses on traditional trades, with tailoring, masonry, and carpentry being the most popular. Nearly 40% of the trainees are women, and the program has also provided over Rs 132.4 crore in loans to help beneficiaries expand their businesses.
title: 11 lakh artisans upskilled under Vishwakarma scheme in 1 year

description: At a recent anti-terror conference in New Delhi, officials from central and state agencies stressed the need for stronger collaboration and a standardized approach to combat terrorism, particularly cybercrime and financial terrorism.  Home Secretary Govind Mohan urged state police forces to prioritize capacity-building and information sharing to effectively address evolving terror threats.
title: Agencies agree to use UAPA judiciously to avoid misuse

description: Ailing 3-month-old wild elephant calf found abandoned in Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve, being treated for dehydration. Discovery follows recent mysterious deaths of 10 elephants in the same reserve, suspected to be caused by fungus-infected kodo millet. Forest officials are monitoring the calf and investigating the elephant deaths.
title: Ailing elephant calf rescued in Bandhavgarh after mysterious jumbo deaths

description: Kerala police investigations into the controversial WhatsApp groups, "Mallu Hindu Officers" and "Mallu Muslim Officers," revealed that IAS officer K Gopalakrishnan's phone, used to create the groups, was not hacked. Technical analysis from WhatsApp, Google, and the officer's ISP contradicted his claims, indicating the phone was secure during the groups' creation.
title: Cops: Phone not hacked to create 'Mallu Officers' WA groups

description: India's Home Minister Amit Shah pledged to reinstate the traditional Nag Panchami cobra worship in Battis Shirala, Maharashtra. The Bombay High Court banned the practice in 2014 following a campaign by wildlife activists. Shah attributed the ban to "vote bank politics" and assured that the celebrations would resume under a BJP-led government while upholding legal boundaries.
title: Nagpanchami celebrations in Shirala will be restored, promises home minister

description: Eleven security guards in Ahmedabad, India, were caught stealing submersible pumps worth Rs 4 lakh from the industrial unit they were hired to protect. They planned the heist during the Diwali holidays, cutting off power and CCTV cameras, but were exposed by a battery-operated camera.
title: Battery-run CCTV camera foils the ‘perfect’ theft

description: The Supreme Court ruled that government-run PSUs cannot unilaterally appoint sole arbitrators or use curated panels for disputes with contractors. This decision, based on the principle of equal treatment, deems such clauses unconstitutional and emphasizes fairness in arbitration proceedings.
title: SC: PSUs can’t unilaterally appoint sole arbitrators

description: The NSCN (IM) has threatened to end its 27-year ceasefire with the Indian government if their demand for a separate flag and constitution is not met. The group proposed third-party mediation to resolve the impasse in the peace talks, warning of a return to violence if their demand is not addressed.
title: Allow third party to mediate or we call off truce: NSCN(IM)

description: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju warned that the BJP government will take a strong stance against any attempts by Opposition parties to disrupt Parliament proceedings in the future. He emphasized that the government is determined to ensure productive discussions and prevent Parliament from becoming a stage for Opposition disruptions, stating that important bills will be passed even if faced with obstructions.
title: Kiren Rijiju warns opposition against disruption of Parliament proceeding

description: A young woman travelling from Hyderabad to Goa caused a security scare at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport by sarcastically commenting about carrying a bomb. Her remark triggered a bomb threat response, leading to a thorough check by security personnel. The situation was resolved when her parents provided medical documentation explaining the metal detected on her person was due to a surgical implant.
title: Woman’s ‘bomb’ remark triggers panic at airport

description: Addressing a rally in Simdega, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi pledged to implement a nationwide caste census and lift the 50% reservation cap if elected. He criticized the BJP for neglecting tribal communities and vowed to protect their rights over land, forests, and water. Gandhi also promised to increase reservation quotas in Jharkhand for STs, SCs, and OBCs.
title: Rahul vows caste census, removal of 50% quota cap

description: HSBC Bank has issued a warning to its customers about a fraudulent WhatsApp group posing as HSBC Asset Management (India) Private Limited. The group, falsely claiming association with CIO Venugopal Manghat, is using the contact number 8008723938 to deceive the public. HSBC clarifies that neither Mr.
title: HSBC Bank has warned about this WhatsApp group & phone number duping people

description: During rallies in Moradabad and Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath strongly criticized the Samajwadi Party, accusing them of protecting criminals and failing to ensure women's safety during their rule. He highlighted his government's achievements, including sugarcane payments to farmers and infrastructure projects.
title: Yogi targets Akhilesh, says women panic at sight of SP men

description: Zeelensky called Trump to congratulate him on the election win and Trump, according to the reports, "did not leave Zelensky with a feeling of despair". "Musk also weighed in during the call to say he will continue supporting Ukraine through his Starlink," reports said. Donald Trump's chat with Zelensky was also positive, the reports said.
title: Donald Trump handed phone to Elon Musk during call with Zelensky: Reports

description: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan accused the Congress party of accepting support from the Jamaat-e-Islami for the Wayanad by-election.  Vijayan criticized the Jamaat-e-Islami, labeling them as communal and alleging their support for BJP in the recent J&K elections.  The Congress party has yet to respond to these allegations.
title: Priyanka Gandhi contesting with help of Jamaat-e-Islami: Kerala CM

description: Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar condemned the use of derogatory language against women in the Maharashtra election campaign and urged strict action against those violating the model code of conduct. Kumar emphasized vigilance against cash distribution and encouraged voter participation, highlighting higher turnouts in other states compared to urban areas like Mumbai.
title: CEC slams undignified remarks against female netas in Maharashtra

description: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) has initiated a campaign called 'Sajag Raho' in Maharashtra to consolidate the Hindu vote ahead of the assembly elections. The campaign, operating through various affiliated organizations, aims to counter what the RSS perceives as attempts to divide Hindus and weaken the BJP's electoral prospects.
title: Sangh, through 65 friendly outfits, launches drive to mobilise Hindu votes for BJP, allies

description: Union home minister Amit Shah, during a rally in Karad, assured that Agniveers from Maharashtra would secure government jobs after their service. He criticized Rahul Gandhi for spreading misinformation about the Agnipath scheme and accused the Congress of failing to implement OROP. Shah also targeted Sharad Pawar and Rahul Gandhi on Article 370, stating that its restoration was impossible.
title: If MVA wins, it will transfer farmers' land to waqf: Amit Shah

description: In the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly, Peoples Conference chief Sajad Lone and four other MLAs introduced a resolution for the restoration of Article 370 and 35A. Lone emphasized the need for a strong response to the 2019 abrogation, calling for measures commensurate with the perceived injustices. Speaker Abdul Rahim Rather deferred an immediate decision on the resolution.
title: Lone, others present fresh 370 resolution

description: Tensions flared in the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly as BJP MLAs staged a parallel "session" after being evicted for protesting a resolution demanding the restoration of Article 370. BJP leader Sunil Sharma criticized the NC-led government, accusing them of separatism and threatening a "parallel govt". Inside the assembly, other MLAs addressed concerns over employee verifications and reservation policies.
title: Article 370 protests: BJP MLAs hold ‘parallel session’ after evictions

description: Pakistan has stated its intention to mediate between the United States and China amidst escalating global tensions. Despite close military ties with the US, Pakistan's economy relies heavily on China, prompting a neutral stance in the face of US-China rivalry. Islamabad emphasized its enduring strategic partnership with China, unaffected by US political shifts, while also expressing a commitment to strengthening its long-standing relationship with the US.
title: Pakistan says it can serve as bridge between US and China

description: Two terrorists were killed in a gunfight with security forces in Sopore, Jammu and Kashmir. The operation followed the discovery of an arms cache at a terrorist hideout.  In a separate incident in Kishtwar, the bodies of two abducted village defense guards were found, prompting protests and calls for increased security measures.
title: J&K forces kill terrorist duo, find bodies of 2 slain village guards near rivulet

description: Three suspected Lashkar-e-Taiba members have been apprehended by Jammu and Kashmir Police in connection with the grenade attack on a Srinagar market earlier this month. The attack, which injured twelve civilians, was orchestrated by the suspects' Pakistan-based handlers.  Security forces have heightened security measures in the city, including night searches, to prevent future attacks.
title: Srinagar grenade attack: LeT trio arrested, booked under UAPA

description: Over 22 individuals tragically lost their lives due to drowning during Chhath festivities in Bihar, India, with Rohtas district reporting the highest number of incidents. The drownings occurred in various rivers and ponds, highlighting the dangers associated with the religious observance.
title: 22 drown, 6 missing during Chhath festivities in state

description: Sanju Samson's record-equaling century, blasting ten sixes in a 50-ball whirlwind, powered India to a commanding 61-run victory over South Africa in the first T20I.  Samson's explosive 107 propelled India to 202, a target the South African batters couldn't match, folding for 141 despite Coetzee's spirited 23.  India takes a 1-0 lead in the series.
title: Centurion Samson stars as India beat SA by 61 runs on opening T20I
Trump assassination bid: US justice department files charges over alleged Iranian plot

description: Sanju Samson etched his name in the record books during the first T20I against South Africa by achieving his third 50+ score, surpassing MS Dhoni and Rishabh Pant. He achieved this feat with an aggressive innings, smashing back-to-back sixes and reaching his half-century off just 27 balls. Samson's powerful performance helped India establish a strong position against South Africa.
title: Samson surpasses Dhoni, Pant for massive T20I feat
Ballistics report confirms Ratapani tiger killed by bullet pumped into its skull

description: A Gujarat family held an elaborate burial ceremony for their 12-year-old Wagon R, which they believe brought them luck and prosperity. The ceremony, costing around Rs 4 lakh, involved lowering the car into a specially dug pit and covering it with soil, following Hindu rituals.
title: Why Gujarati family held last rites of 'lucky car' - Watch
India to conduct major tri-Service exercise in eastern sector

description: Sanju Samson equaled Rohit Sharma's record of ten sixes in a T20I innings during his explosive 107-run knock against South Africa in Durban. This remarkable feat also marked Samson's second consecutive T20I century, making him the first Indian to achieve this milestone. His aggressive batting propelled India to a competitive total of 202/8.
title: Samson blasts record sixes, equals massive Rohit feat

description: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu dismissed allegations of a CID investigation into a snack mix-up, calling it an internal CID matter. The controversy arose when snacks meant for the CM were mistakenly served to his security staff. BJP leader Jairam Thakur criticized the government's handling of the situation, hosting a samosa party in protest.
title: Watch: BJP's 'samosa' party amid Himachal CM Sukhu's snack mix-up row

description: Elon Musk reports that his platform, X, formerly Twitter, has reached record usage during the US presidential election.  Musk's support for Donald Trump, through both significant financial contributions and the platform's amplification of pro-Trump messaging, played a key role in Trump's victory.
title: Elon Musk claims X records all-time high usage

description: Sanju Samson etched his name in the record books during the first T20I against South Africa by achieving his third 50+ score, surpassing MS Dhoni and Rishabh Pant. He achieved this feat with an aggressive innings, smashing back-to-back sixes and reaching his half-century off just 27 balls. Samson's powerful performance helped India establish a strong position against South Africa.
title: Samson surpasses Dhoni, Pant for massive T20I feat

description: Sanju Samson hit his second century in a row in the first T20 international against South Africa. He achieved this feat in Durban. He is the first Indian to score back-to-back centuries in T20 internationals. Samson's century came from 47 balls. His innings included seven fours and nine sixes. India scored 163/2 in 14.1 overs.
title: Samson slams ton vs SA, becomes first Indian to...

description: The BJP has threatened to establish a parallel government in Jammu and Kashmir if Assembly Speaker Abdul Rahim Rather doesn't stop actions they deem detrimental to national sovereignty. This follows days of chaos in the Assembly sparked by a resolution demanding the restoration of special status to the Union Territory, a move the BJP vehemently opposes.
title: Will run parallel govt if J&K Speaker challenges sovereignty of country: BJP

description: Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud, in his farewell speech, acknowledged being "one of the most trolled judges" but remained unfazed. He emphasized transparency and integrity as guiding principles throughout his tenure, drawing inspiration from his father's advice on upholding judicial ethics.
title: 'Trollers will now be unemployed': CJI Chandrachud in farewell speech

description: President-elect Donald Trump has appointed Susan Wiles, his former campaign manager, as White House Chief of Staff. Wiles, the first woman to hold this position, is a seasoned Republican operative known for her tough and disciplined approach.
title: Trump names campaign manager Susie Wiles as his White House chief of staff

description: The Golden State Warriors, off to a strong start this season, are rumored to be considering a significant trade. ESPN insider Brian Windhorst suggests the Warriors are looking to add a star player to their roster, despite their early success.
title: NBA insider Brian Windhorst predicts Golden State Warriors eye major trade

description: Bollywood is brimming with news! Imran Khan may be returning to the screen, while Athiya Shetty and KL Rahul announce their pregnancy. Deepika and Ranveer make a rare appearance with their daughter, Dua.  Meanwhile, Salman Khan faces another threat, and Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli enjoy a quiet breakfast together.
title: Athiya-Rahul's pregnancy to Deepika -Ranveer's outing: Top 5 entertainment news

description: Musk, who appeared at a Trump rally in October sporting an “Occupy Mars” T-shirt, reportedly spent $119 million supporting Trump’s White House bid. Just last month, Musk announced that SpaceX’s Starship could land on Mars by 2026, with a crewed mission planned four years later. Trump has also voiced interest in Musk’s goals, describing the moon as a stepping stone to Mars in recent statements.
title: With Trump in White House, will Elon Musk's Mars mission get a boost?

description: Security measures at Donald Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence have been heightened following his presidential election victory.  Footage released by Reuters shows robotic dogs patrolling the property.  Meanwhile, Trump has been engaging in phone calls with current leaders, including a congratulatory call from Hillary Clinton and an invitation for an Oval Office meeting from President Joe Biden to discuss the transition process.
title: Watch: Robotic dog patrols at president-elect Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence

description: As Donald Trump returns to the political stage, his campaign promise to swiftly end the Russia-Ukraine war is under scrutiny. While Trump claims he could broker peace within 24 hours, experts are skeptical, citing the conflict's complexity and Trump's mixed record on foreign policy. The outcome holds significant implications for global geopolitics and the future of Ukraine.
title: Russia-Ukraine war: Can Donald Trump end it in 24 hours?

description: At least five Israeli soccer fans were hospitalized, and over 60 were detained after being attacked in Amsterdam following a match between Ajax and Maccabi Tel Aviv. Police described the attacks as antisemitic, with assailants targeting Israeli fans throughout the city.
title: Israeli soccer fans attacked in Amsterdam, Netanyahu demands 'vigorous action'

description: India's antitrust watchdog, the Competition Commission of India (CCI), is investigating food delivery giants Zomato and Swiggy for alleged anti-competitive practices.
title: Zomato and Swiggy allegedly violating India’s competition law

description: Sharing the news on social media, Athiya Shetty referred to the baby as their “beautiful blessing,” expressing excitement for the new addition to their family. The announcement has brought joy to fans and well-wishers, who have flooded the couple’s posts with congratulations and heartfelt messages. Rahul and Athiya, who married in January 2023, will welcome their first child next year.
title: KL Rahul-Athiya Shetty make a huge announcement on social media

description: Elon Musk's significant support for Donald Trump against Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election, including substantial financial contributions and leveraging his platform X (formerly Twitter), played a crucial role in Trump's victory. Musk's actions transformed X into a powerful platform for pro-Trump messaging, raising concerns about misinformation and political influence.
title: The X-factor: How Musk 'bought' US govt in $44 billion
Rahul like unguided missile, urge Sonia Gandhi to coach him: Himanta Biswa Sarma

description: Netflix India reported a 49% surge in net profit to Rs 52 crore for fiscal year 2024, fueled by a 29% growth in revenue, reaching Rs 2,845 crore. This success is attributed to a growing subscriber base, the introduction of mobile-specific plans, and a strategic focus on local content production.
title: Netflix co-CEO reveals 'most-popular' drama series on platform

description: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were seen in Mumbai, where a fan's selfie attempt during their interaction with the media went viral.  The cricketer also shared glimpses of his low-key 36th birthday celebration, emphasizing his daughter's role in it. Now, his attention turns to the upcoming Test series against Australia, aiming to bounce back from a recent slump in form.
title: Watch: Fan grabs Kohli by arm for selfie during Mumbai visit

description: Imagine if India, with its diverse and populous states, adopted a similar Electoral College system for its general elections. How would key states like Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, and West Bengal, known for their significant populations, impact the results? In such a model, securing the majority vote in a few large states could potentially change the entire outcome, making India’s federal elections more strategic and less about direct popular support. With that in mind, let’s explore what India’s 2014, 2019, and 2024 elections might look like if they were held under an Electoral College system similar to that of the US.
title: Would Modi win if India followed US election system?

description: The start of the India-South Africa T20I match in Durban was met with an unexpected technical hiccup when the Indian national anthem was interrupted twice.  Fans expressed frustration and disappointment over the disruption, deeming it disrespectful. Despite the incident, both teams were ready to focus on the game, with South Africa opting to bowl first after winning the toss.
title: Viral Video: India national anthem abruptly stops twice vs SA

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, along with other prominent BJP figures, visited L.K. Advani's residence to celebrate his 97th birthday. They praised Advani's contributions to India's development, his long political career, and his role in shaping the BJP into a leading political force.
title: PM Modi meets BJP leader LK Advani on his 97th birthday
'Ek hai toh safe hai': PM Modi’s new pitch after Yogi's 'batenge toh katenge' slogan

description: The Supreme Court, in a split verdict, overturned a 1967 ruling that stripped Aligarh Muslim University of its minority status. However, the court referred the final decision on reinstating the status to a three-judge bench, leaving the matter unresolved.
title: AMU minority status case: Supreme Court overrules 1967 verdict - Top 10 takeaways

description: Stephen Curry and Steve Kerr, despite previously endorsing Kamala Harris, have publicly acknowledged Donald Trump's victory in the 2024 Presidential Election.  Both Curry and Kerr expressed hope for a successful term for Trump and emphasized the importance of unity and support for the country's well-being.
title: Warriors star who endorsed Harris gives a surprising remark on Trump’s win

description: As Vice President, Harris remains first in line for presidential succession. Should President Biden be unable to serve due to health or unforeseen circumstances, Harris would assume the presidency. This would allow her to govern as President and potentially position her as an incumbent for the next election, presenting a new opportunity to earn the role in her own right.
title: Can Kamala Harris still become US President?

description: As the Kansas City Chiefs dominate the NFL with an 8-0 record, Brittany Mahomes, wife of quarterback Patrick Mahomes, is rallying support for the Kansas City Current. Co-founded by Brittany, the women's soccer team is gearing up for a crucial playoff match, and she's urging fans to bring the same energy they show for the Chiefs.
title: Brittany Mahomes sends bold 9-word message to Kansas City, sparks excitement

description: Indian cricketer KL Rahul and Bollywood actress Athiya Shetty have announced they are expecting their first child in 2025. The couple, who married in a private ceremony in January 2023, shared the news on social media, receiving an outpouring of well wishes from fans and fellow celebrities.
title: KL Rahul and Athiya Shetty announce first pregnancy

description: Chief Justice of India (CJI) D.Y. Chandrachud delivered an emotional farewell address on his last working day, expressing gratitude for the opportunity to serve the nation and highlighting the importance of justice. CJI Chandrachud's tenure, marked by landmark judgments on Article 370, same-sex marriage, and electoral bonds, was praised by colleagues and legal luminaries.
title: 'No greater feeling than serving those in need': CJI Chandrachud's emotional farewell speech

description: Indian festive seasons bring delicious sweets called mithai. Mithai contains high amounts of sugar and fat. Eating too much mithai can lead to weight gain. Mithai is low in fiber and can make you feel hungry quickly. You can still enjoy mithai without gaining weight. Eat small portions and choose sweets with less sugar.
title: Hard to think! How a few grams of mithai make you gain kilos of weight

description: Shahid Afridi praised Pakistan's resounding 9-wicket victory over Australia in the second ODI, highlighting Mohammad Rizwan's impactful captaincy debut. Afridi emphasized Rizwan's leadership in inspiring the team's remarkable comeback, securing their first-ever nine-wicket win against Australia on their home turf.
title: 'When a captain...': Afridi takes a dig at Babar after win vs Aus

description: Changpeng Zhao, founder of Binance, recently shared his experience in prison following his guilty plea to anti-money laundering charges. Despite his time served, Zhao claims his reputation remains intact, with inmates and guards even seeking his cryptocurrency advice.
title: World's richest 'techie' prisoner shares tips that other inmates asked him for
Zoho’s Sridhar Vembu calls out 'naked greed' of company with '$1 bn cash' for fresh layoffs

description: Virat Kohli celebrated a relaxed 36th birthday at home with his family after being surprised with a rendition of 'Happy Birthday' by fans at a promotional event in Mumbai. The cricketer, now a father of one, acknowledged his recent dip in form as he prepares for the upcoming Test series against Australia.
title: Watch: Kohli's reaction goes viral as crowd sings 'Happy Birthday'

description: On the eighth anniversary of demonetisation, Rahul Gandhi criticized the policy, stating it damaged MSMEs and the informal sector while failing to curb cash usage. He highlighted that cash as a percentage of GDP is higher now than before demonetisation, advocating for policies that support fair businesses.
title: 'India continues to use more cash today': Rahul on demonetisation anniversary

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Congress and the MVA during his Maharashtra campaign. He accused them of hindering reservations and disregarding the Constitution. Modi highlighted his government's efforts in poverty reduction and women's empowerment. He also criticized Congress for its dependence on other parties for electoral success.
title: 'Nehru, Gandhis never backed quota': Top quotes from PM Modi's rally in Maharashtra

description: State Bank of India reported a net profit of Rs 18,331 crore in the second quarter of FY25, marking a 27.92% increase. Net interest income also saw a rise of 5.37%, reaching Rs 41,620 crore. The bank's credit grew by 14.93% year-on-year, reaching Rs 39.21 lakh crore, with significant growth in domestic advances, SME, and retail personal loans.
title: SBI Q2 results: Net profits increased by more than 27%

description: The Supreme Court is reviewing a Jharkhand government plea against a high court order. The high court had formed a committee to investigate alleged illegal immigration from Bangladesh, a claim Jharkhand disputes. The state argues it has already addressed the issue and calls the claims baseless.
title: SC issues notice to Centre on J'Khand's plea against HC order on illegal immigration

description: Pakistan's wicketkeeper-batsman Mohammad Rizwan set a world record by taking six catches in a single ODI innings during Pakistan's victory over Australia in Adelaide on Friday. Rizwan's record-equaling performance behind the stumps helped Pakistan bowl out Australia for a modest total, which they chased down comfortably to secure a series win.
title: Rizwan equals world record with most catches in ODI innings

description: You are either deeply upset about the rising cis-hetero-patriarchy or thrilled you don’t have to announce your pronouns again. Now, there has been a lot of coverage, but let yours truly explain, in very simple terms, without the highfalutin polysyllabic words that one often employs, why Trump won.
title: Don Deal: 10 simple reasons why Donald Trump easily won

description: The Australia Today, an Australian media outlet, was blocked by the Canadian government after airing an interview with India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar. Jaishankar criticized Canada for making allegations against India without evidence and for providing a platform to anti-India elements.
title: 'Will continue to advocate for open media': Australian outlet on Canada ban

description: Bollywood actress Swara Bhasker has turned to crowdfunding to support her husband, Fahad Ahmad's, political campaign. Ahmad, a recent addition to the Nationalist Congress Party, is contesting the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly elections from the Anushakti Nagar constituency. He is running as a candidate for the NCP-SP alliance, part of the larger Maha Vikas Aghadi coalition.
title: Swara Bhasker crowdfunds for husband Fahad Ahmad’s Maharashtra poll campaign

description: Urfan Sharif, the father of 10-year-old Sara Sharif found dead with multiple injuries, denied murdering his daughter in a London court. He blamed his partner, Beinash Batool, for the abuse, describing her as "evil" and claiming she forced him to hit Sara. Sharif admitted to slapping his daughter and finding her bound with tape but denied causing her fatal injuries.
title: 'Evil and psycho': Father accused of killing 10-yr-old blames stepmother

description: Kerala's Chief Minister, Pinarayi Vijayan, has launched a scathing attack on the Congress party, alleging its candidate in the Wayanad by-election, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, is receiving support from the Jamaat-e-Islami. Vijayan questioned the Congress's secular credentials, highlighting the Jamaat-e-Islami's history of opposing democratic processes and aligning with the BJP in Kashmir.
title: 'Priyanka Gandhi contesting Wayanad bypoll with Jamaat-e-Islami support'

description: Pakistan leveled the three-match ODI series against Australia with a resounding nine-wicket victory in Adelaide. Opener Saim Ayub's brilliant 82, featuring a  six that reminded of India's Yuvraj Singh, and Haris Rauf's five-wicket haul propelled Pakistan to a comfortable win, setting up a series decider in Perth.
title: Pak batter Ayub breaks the internet with Yuvraj-like six - Watch

description: Despite diplomatic efforts to restore cricketing ties between India and Pakistan, the Indian cricket team will not travel to Pakistan for the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy. Hopes were raised after a meeting between high-ranking officials from both countries, but the BCCI has maintained its stance over touring the neighbouring nation.
title: India say no to playing Champions Trophy matches in Pakistan

description: Parag Shah, a BJP candidate in Mumbai, has seen his assets skyrocket to over Rs 3,400 crore, a 500% increase since 2019.  He leads a pack of wealthy Mumbai MLA candidates, with several others also declaring assets over Rs 100 crore.  Experts, however, question the accuracy of these declarations, citing potential underreporting and a lack of thorough verification by authorities.
title: Mumbai's super rich MLAs are in Rs 100-crore-plus league

description: China's Zhurong rover has discovered evidence suggesting Mars once had an ocean. The rover found geological formations similar to coastlines on Earth. These formations indicate the presence of a large body of water in Mars's past. Scientists believe this ocean existed around 3.68 billion years ago and froze over relatively quickly. This discovery provides further support for the theory that Mars may have once been habitable.
title: Chinese rover Zhurong uncovers evidence of ancient ocean on Mars

description: Bhujangasana, also known as the Cobra Pose, can be an effective way to alleviate lower back pain.  Warming up beforehand is crucial, and proper alignment is key to avoiding injury. Engaging the core and glutes, along with deep breathing, enhances the pose's benefits.  It's important to start slowly and gradually increase the duration and intensity, listening to your body's limits.
title: How Bhujangasana can help reduce lower back pain (5 tips to do it correctly)

description: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan received a threatening phone call demanding ₹50 lakh, leading to a police investigation. The call, traced to Raipur, Chhattisgarh, prompted Mumbai Police to investigate a suspect named Mohammad Faizan Khan, a lawyer. Faizan claims his phone, which was reported stolen, was used to make the threat.
title: Shah Rukh Khan death threat case: Threat message, extortion and other details

description: The new Dzire is powered by a new Z-series, 1.2-litre, 3-cylinder, NA petrol engine with 82 hp power and 112 nm torque. This engine made its debut with the new Swift and the Dzire is the second Maruti model to be equipped with this powertrain. Gearbox options will include a 5-speed manual and an AMT.
title: New Maruti Suzuki Dzire crash test results: First ever Maruti to get 5 stars!

description: The Indian Rupee hit a new low against the US dollar, dropping to 84.37, influenced by foreign fund outflows and the US Federal Reserve's recent interest rate cut. The Fed's decision, along with global market uncertainties, has created a volatile landscape for the Rupee. Experts believe the Reserve Bank of India's response will be crucial in navigating this situation.
title: Rupee slips 5 paise to all-time low of 84.37 against US dollar

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized leaders of the Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance. He condemned their alleged derogatory comments about women. The Prime Minister emphasized that women in Maharashtra should be cautious of the alliance members. He stated that the people of Maharashtra are witnessing the disrespectful behavior of the alliance towards women.
title: 'What kind of obscene language?' PM Modi slams MVA leaders amid 'maal' remark row

description: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu clarified a recent controversy surrounding a CID probe into snacks meant for him that were mistakenly served to his security staff. Sukhu emphasized that the CID's involvement stemmed from alleged misbehavior, not the food itself. The BJP criticized the incident, linking it to the state's financial struggles and the Congress party's policies.
title: 'Samosa' row: Himanchal CM clarifies, says CID got involved on issue of misbehavior

description: Glenn Maxwell has described his departure from Royal Challengers Bengaluru as a "beautiful" parting. Despite not being retained by the franchise, Maxwell expressed satisfaction with how the decision was handled, praising RCB's professionalism and transparency.  While acknowledging the team's need to rebuild, Maxwell expressed his openness to returning to the franchise in the future.
title: Maxwell breaks silence on RCB retentions, reveals chat with management

description: "I’ve spent the past 17 years deeply committed to helping survivors of abuse and trafficking, and it is incredibly disappointing to see the narrative shift toward unrelated and controversial topics. I have no interest in discussing individuals from my past or anything beyond the work we do at No More Tears"
title: Salman-Lawrence Bishnoi feud: Somy Ali says previous comments misinterpreted

description: Former Australian captain Gregg Chappell believes that aging players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma face a battle of wits and endurance in the upcoming Border Gavaskar Trophy. He emphasizes the need for these veterans to recapture the mindset of their younger selves and adapt to the strategies employed by opponents who have studied their weaknesses.
title: 'For ageing Rohit and Kohli, the true battle is against...'

description: Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud inaugurated the National Judicial Museum and Archive and interacted with an AI lawyer asking about capital punishment in India. The AI responded, "Yes, the death penalty is constitutional in India. It is reserved for the rarest of rare cases as determined by the Supreme Court where the crime is exceptionally heinous and warrants such a punishment."
title: Watch: CJI asks AI lawyer, 'Is death penalty constitutional in India?'

description: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu criticized Freshworks on X for laying off 13% of its workforce, despite having $1 billion in cash and a $400 million stock buyback program. Vembu called the layoffs "naked greed" and questioned the company's lack of vision in investing in its employees.
title: Zoho CEO slams job cuts at Fresh works: ‘...this is naked greed …’

description: Elon Musk has predicted that Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will lose the next election. Musk's comment came amidst criticism of Trudeau's policies, including his stance on free speech and immigration.
title: Read Elon Musk’s reply to startup CEO seeking help to ‘get rid’ of Canada PM

description: Twenty-two years after supplying methanol that killed 53 people in Tamil Nadu, a 58-year-old man has been arrested. James Bond, alias Teja Anand, had been supplying methanol to bootleggers in Panruti, Cuddalore, leading to the hooch tragedy in November 2001.  Police traced Bond to Tirupur, where he had been living under an assumed identity after fleeing his hometown.
title: 2001 TN hooch tragedy: How 'James Bond' evaded arrest for 23 years

description: KL Rahul's struggles with the bat continued in the second innings of the unofficial Test against Australia A at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, scoring only 10 runs. This follows his disappointing first-innings score of four. He is in contention to open the innings for India against Australia if Rohit Sharma skips the first Test.
title: KL Rahul's horror show with the bat continues in Australia

description: Rajender Prasad, a Hindu priest in Canada previously suspended for alleged "violent rhetoric," has been reinstated by the Hindu Sabha Temple. The Hindu Canadian Foundation criticized Brampton's Mayor for his role in the situation, demanding an explanation. Prasad's suspension stemmed from an incident involving Khalistani demonstrators at the temple.
title: Hindu priest suspended in Canada for 'violent rhetoric' reinstated

description: Intel is bringing back free coffee and tea for its employees after cutting the perk last summer to reduce costs. The company acknowledged that these "small comforts" are important for workplace morale. This comes after Intel announced plans to cut over 15,000 jobs and reduce expenses by more than $10 billion due to financial challenges and industry competition.
title: 'Coffee gives a high', and how Intel's HR agrees to this

description: Prince William candidly shared that the past year has been the most challenging of his life due to his father, King Charles, and wife, Kate Middleton, facing cancer diagnoses. Despite the personal difficulties, William remains committed to his royal duties, particularly his environmental work with the Earthshot Prize, emphasizing the importance of balancing his responsibilities with family time.
title: Prince William opens up on cancer diagnoses of wife, father

description: Virat Kohli, widely regarded as one of cricket's all-time greats, celebrated his 36th birthday with a simple family gathering. Despite the joyous occasion, Kohli acknowledged the pressure he faces as he prepares for India's upcoming Test series against Australia. The Border-Gavaskar Trophy, to be played across five Tests starting November 22, begins in Perth.
title: Watch: How Virat Kohli celebrated his 36th birthday

description: Virat Kohli, during an event, shared a hilarious anecdote about his first encounter with Sachin Tendulkar in 2008.  As a prank orchestrated by Irfan Pathan and Munaf Patel, Kohli was led to believe he had to touch Tendulkar's feet as a gesture of respect, leaving the legend bewildered and Kohli struggling to explain the situation.
title: 'Pairon mein gir gaya': Virat recalls hilarious first meeting with Sachin
Watch: Ruckus in J&K assembly continues for 3rd day; BJP MLAs storm well of House

description: Television actor Nitin Chauhan, known for his win on the reality show Dadagiri 2 and appearances in shows like Splitsvilla 5 and Crime Patrol, has died at the age of 35. His co-stars expressed shock and paid tribute on social media, remembering him for his strength and positive demeanor.
title: Splitsvilla fame Nitin Chauhan passes away at 35; co-stars mourn his sudden demise
'This year is even more special': PM Modi extends birthday wishes to LK Advani

description: Former India coach Ravi Shastri, known for his candid nature, reminisced about his playing days alongside teammate Sandeep Patil at the launch of Patil's autobiography. Shastri humorously described their hearty appetites, stating they 'ate like pigs' and often spent their earnings on food and drinks. He also highlighted their early indulgence in 'liquid refreshments' after matches.
title: Ravi Shastri: By 6.30 pm we were on 'wet wicket'

description: India's purchase of Russian oil during market instability helped stabilize global prices, preventing a potential surge to $200 per barrel, according to Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri. He stated that India's actions benefited all nations and highlighted the importance of securing affordable energy for its citizens.
title: 'Did everyone a favour!': Union minister explains why India bought Russian oil

description: iPhone 15 is the world's top-selling smartphone. Apple's Pro models are in high demand. Samsung holds a strong position with five phones in the top 10. Galaxy S24 remains popular for a third quarter. Samsung's Galaxy A series performs well in various markets. Xiaomi's Redmi 13C continues to be a budget-friendly choice.
title: This iPhone model is the world’s best-selling smartphone in Q3 2024

description: Indian T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav found a unique way to welcome newcomers Vyshak Vijaykumar and Ramandeep Singh to the team. In a video shared by BCCI, Surya, playing the role of a chef, introduced the players as new additions to the team's menu. Both players are hoping to make their debuts in the upcoming four-match T20I series against South Africa.
title: Watch: 'Chef' Suryakumar Yadav presents his new 'recipes'

description: Elon Musk predicts Justin Trudeau's defeat in the upcoming Canadian election. Trudeau faces challenges from opposition parties and grapples with diplomatic tensions with India, economic concerns related to potential Trump policies, and criticism over free speech regulations.
title: 'He will be gone': Elon Musk predicts Trudeau's fate in Canada's next election

description: Bollywood star Salman Khan received a death threat from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, prompting a police investigation in Mumbai.
title: Salman Khan receives fresh death threat from Lawrence Bishnoi gang

description: Former England cricketer Ian Botham recently had a close call with crocodiles in Australia. While on a fishing trip, Botham fell into crocodile-infested waters. Thankfully, his former Ashes rival, Merv Hughes, was quick to react and pulled him to safety. The fall left Botham with severe bruising to the side of his torso.
title: Botham survives horror fall into crocodile-infested waters

description: Former One Direction member Liam Payne tragically passed away in Buenos Aires at 29 after falling from a hotel balcony. Toxicology reports revealed a combination of cocaine, alcohol, and antidepressants in his system. Three individuals have been charged in connection with his death for allegedly supplying him with drugs.
title: Liam Payne's toxicology details: 'Cocaine, alcohol & antidepressants'

description: Former Pakistan batsman Basit Ali has claimed that there is a 70% chance that India will play their Champions Trophy matches in Lahore.  The Pakistan Cricket Board has already offered to host all of India's matches in Lahore to facilitate their participation. However, a hybrid model with India playing their matches outside Pakistan is still possible.
title: Champions Trophy: 'Lahore walo, India ke liye taiyar ho jao'

description: Delhi police arrested three men, including an auto driver, for the gang rape of a 34-year-old woman researcher. The woman, who has a mental health condition, was found abandoned in Sarai Kale Khan.  Police used CCTV footage, technical surveillance, and human intelligence to identify and apprehend the suspects.
title: Delhi: 2 men raped ‘easy target’, auto driver joined in and then dumped her

description: Kartik Aaryan's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' enjoyed a successful first week at the box office, surpassing the Rs 150 crore mark. Despite competition from 'Singham Again', the film achieved this milestone, adding to Aaryan's string of successes.  The horror comedy is now aiming to outdo 'Singham Again's total earnings of Rs 173 crore before facing competition from upcoming Hollywood releases.
title: Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3: Kartik Aaryan starrer film crosses Rs 150 crore mark

description: Team India is set to embark on a challenging tour of Australia. The team's pace attack, considered a strength in recent times, is facing uncertainty.  Jasprit Bumrah remains a key player, but the lack of experience in the supporting bowlers is a concern.  Former selectors and coaches weigh in on the team's composition and the challenges ahead for the crucial series.
title: BGT: Pace attack wears an uncertain look as India head Down Under

description: Veteran Republican strategist Susie Wiles has been appointed as the first female White House Chief of Staff by US President-elect Donald Trump.  Wiles, known for her strategic prowess and success in managing Trump's 2024 campaign, brings decades of experience in Republican politics, particularly in Florida, to her new role.
title: Who is Susie Wiles, first woman White House chief of staff

description: Nissan Motor Corp. is implementing a major restructuring plan that includes 9,000 job cuts and a 20% reduction in production capacity.  These measures come as the automaker grapples with a 94% drop in net income and aims to refocus on the burgeoning electric and hybrid vehicle sectors.
title: Nissan to cut 9,000 jobs globally; CEO accepts these 'big problems'

description: Despite concerns about potential changes to US immigration laws, India's IT sector is optimistic about Donald Trump's return as US President. The industry is hopeful for a strong dollar, stable policymaking, better tax policies for corporations, and increased US investment as an alternative to China.
title: 4 Big Reasons Indian IT sector is 'happy' with Donald Trump's return

description: Kartik Aaryan's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3' enjoyed a successful first week at the box office, surpassing the Rs 150 crore mark. Despite competition from 'Singham Again', the film achieved this milestone, adding to Aaryan's string of successes.  The horror comedy is now aiming to outdo 'Singham Again's total earnings of Rs 173 crore before facing competition from upcoming Hollywood releases.
title: Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3: Kartik Aaryan starrer film crosses Rs 150 crore mark

description: Former Indian wicketkeeper-batsman Dinesh Karthik has defended senior players facing retirement calls after India's Test series loss to New Zealand. Karthik believes demanding retirements after one series is premature and suggests reassessing after 10 Test matches. Karthik acknowledged India's struggles, particularly against spin bowling, but urged patience and a long-term perspective.
title: 'What is the hurry boss?': Karthik on calls for retirement of seniors

description: Donald Trump has appointed Susie Wiles as his White House chief of staff, making her the first woman to hold the position. Wiles, a veteran Republican strategist, played a key role in Trump's successful 2024 presidential campaign. Known for her ability to manage Trump's behavior, Wiles is expected to bring stability and experience to the role.
title: Trump appoints Susie Wiles chief of staff, marking historic first

description: Gurgaon's new municipal commissioner, Ashok Kumar Garg, has mandated all MCG officials to use common washrooms, eliminating private ones, to promote hygiene and set an example for public sanitation. Garg aims to improve the city's cleanliness, particularly addressing the persistent garbage issue that has plagued its streets.
title: To maintain public loos, Gurgaon civic chief locks up officials’ private toilets

description: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy, in an interview, highlighted his government's achievements as it nears its one-year mark. He defended his farm loan waiver scheme and addressed concerns regarding the caste survey, emphasizing its role in promoting social equality. Reddy reiterated his commitment to increasing reservations for Backward Classes, even suggesting a constitutional amendment.
title: We are going to break 50% reservation barricade, says Telangana CM
